title: Doing accountability: a discourse analysis of research ethics committee letters

Both because of their position in the research process and because of the controversial nature of ethical judgements, RECs’ views and decisions need to be accountable. In this paper we use techniques of discourse analysis to show how REC decision letters ‘do’ accountability. Using a sample of 260 letters from three datasets, we identify a range of discursive devices used in letters written by RECs.
